title: TJ Eyoma
text:
Timothy Joel "TJ" Eyoma (born 29 January 2000) is an English professional <a href="association%20football">football</a> <a href="Defender%20%28association%20football%29">defender</a> who plays for <a href="EFL%20League%20One">EFL League One</a> side <a href="Lincoln%20City%20FC">Lincoln City</a>.
Early and personal life.
Eyoma was born and raised in <a href="Hackney%2C%20London">Hackney</a> and attended <a href="Highbury%20Grove%20School">Highbury Grove School</a>. His brother Aaron Eyoma or "AJ" is also a footballer, who was previously at <a href="Arsenal%20F.C.">Arsenal</a> and <a href="Derby%20County%20F.C.">Derby County</a>. Eyoma played youth football at Clissold Rangers and <a href="Islington">Islington</a>-based club <a href="Crown%20%26amp%3B%20Manor%20F.C.">Crown & Manor</a>.
Career.
Early career.
Described as comfortable at centre back and right back, in September 2018 Eyoma signed a professional contract with Spurs until 2021. On 4 January 2019 he was named as a substitute against <a href="Tranmere%20Rovers%20F.C.">Tranmere Rovers</a> for the <a href="FA%20Cup">FA Cup</a> match at <a href="Prenton%20Park">Prenton Park</a> and came on to make his first team debut.
Lincoln City.
On 30 January 2020, Eyoma joined Lincoln City on loan until the end of the 2019–20 season. But due to the <a href="COVID-19%20pandemic">COVID-19 pandemic</a> cutting short the season, he would not feature for Lincoln City and would return to <a href="Tottenham%20Hotspur%20F.C.">Tottenham Hotspur</a> without making an appearance. On 11 August 2020, Eyoma rejoined Lincoln City on a season-long loan until the end of the 2020–21 campaign. shortly after signing a new three-year contract with Tottenham. He would make his Lincoln City debut against <a href="Crewe%20Alexandra%20F.C.">Crewe Alexandra</a> in the <a href="EFL%20Cup">EFL Cup</a> on the opening day of the season. On 17 August 2021 it was announced by Lincoln City that Eyoma would rejoin the Imps for a third time, as a permanent signing for an undisclosed fee. He would make his first appearance as a full-time Lincoln City player in the <a href="EFL%20Trophy">EFL Trophy</a> against <a href="Manchester%20United%20F.C.%20Reserves%20and%20Academy">Manchester United U21</a>.
International career.
Born in England, Eyoma is of Nigerian descent. Eyoma was part of the England side that won the U17 World Cup in India.
Honours.
England U17
